title: Bug 19089: Missing Popup Menu in Java Editor Ruler (Photon)
description: The bug report addresses the issue of a missing popup menu in the Java editor ruler of the Photon version.
OB:
The observed behavior is as follows:
- In the Photon version, when performing the following actions:
  1) Open a Java editor.
  2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler,
  the expected behavior is that a popup menu should appear, allowing the user to add breakpoints, marks, and other similar items. However, this expected behavior is not occurring as described.
EB: The expected behavior in the Photon version is that when a Java editor is open, right-clicking on the left vertical ruler should trigger a popup menu. This popup menu should provide options to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant functionalities. However, the bug report highlights that this expected behavior is not being met.
SR:
To reproduce the issue in the Photon version, follow these steps:
1) Open a Java editor.
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler. The expected behavior is that a popup menu should appear, allowing you to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant items. However, in this version, the popup menu is not appearing as expected.
